Description: Fragmentary model of ceremonial staff in copper alloy; hollow-cast papyriform staff, surmounted by a solid-cast figure of raised uraeus (cobra); lower part of staff broken; repaired at the base of the uraeus; surface corroded.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Town (Naukratis), House of 'cache of bronzes'
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

This ceremonial staff originated from a bronzes’ cache found in a building located in the southern part of the city (on this cache: Petrie 1886, 41-42). This cache can be dated around the end of the 5th-beginning of the 4th century BC, but could contain material of earlier date (Masson 2015). This bronze votive belongs to the type T 12a in the typology of animal bronzes by K. Weiss (Weiss 2012, 276, 725, Pl. 42a/b, Typ T 12a, esp. Nr. 739 for this specimen). A parallel is known from the falcon catacomb in North Saqqrah (Davies, Smith 2005, 108, pl. LVI c). It could have served in the frame of processions or it could just be a model. Davies, S., Smith, H.S., The sacred animal necropolis at North Saqqara: the falcon complex and catacomb (Egypt Exploration Society Memoirs 73), London. Masson, A. 2015, ‘Cult and Trade. A reflexion on Egyptian metal offerings from Naukratis’, in D. Robinson and F. Goddio (eds), Thonis Heracleion in Context, Oxford Centre for Maritime Archaeology Monograph 8, Oxford, 71-88. Petrie, W. M. F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I., 1884-5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Weiss, K. 2012, Ägyptische Tier- und Götterbronzen aus Unterägypten: Untersuchungen zu Typus, Ikonographie und Funktion sowie der Bedeutung innerhalb der Kulturkontakte zu Griechenland, Ägypten und Altes Testament 81.
Bibliographic references: Weiss 2012 / Ägyptische Tier- und Götterbronzen aus Unterägypten : Untersuchungen zu Typus, Ikonographie und Funktion sowie der Bedeutung innerhalb der Kulturkontakte zu Griechenland (Typ T 12a, Taf. 42a, Nr. 739)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (MC.10) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
